I have gotten several games (300+ photos and 3-hours of on-time) without replacing the battery.With kids who are three-sport athletes, I shoot in poorly-lit conditions--night football, in gyms--and I used to have to manually set the ASA and shutter speed for the action. The HS30EXR has a "Sport" mode that produces game/meet photos better than manual settings. The face detection function in EXR mode makes sure that faces are what gets optimized for lighting the focus.From shooting outdoors in all conditions, I needed a camera that was heavy on the features, but not so expensive that I'd be afraid to take it out in the rain or snow, and the HS30EXR packs a lot of features and quality for the price. A couple pleasant surprises have been how nice the large external screen is for both shooting and for reviewing photos, and that the screen goes blank when the camera senses that you've put your eye to the eyepiece.I was worried about the duration of the charge of the proprietary battery and the cost of replacements, but as written above, the Fuji battery has been an advantage over AA's. Another concern was that I was used to a motorized zoom, and the HS30EXR's zoom is manual. That took very little time to get used to, plus it's less of a drain on the battery. It also took very little time to get used to the controls which are different than my old FujiFilm camera. The HS30EXR uses the more common SD card rather than xD.There's so much that this camera can do that I go through the manual (downloaded as PDF online) and try to learn one new thing at a time. Get yourself a large SD card, as you'll probably be taking a lot of photos. Get a Class 10 card for fast read/write times (video and burst-mode photos).

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE CAMERA MANUAL
Reviews.Author: Catherine Cataldi
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THE CAMERA, HOWEVER THE MANUAL IS TERRIBLE. IT'S APPROX. 29 SLIM PAGES. IT IS IN NO WAY INFORMATIVE. IT DOES NOT EXPLAIN IN DETAIL ALL THE FUNCTIONS OF THE CAMERA.THERE ARE MANY. I E-MAILED FUJI FILM OF THE SITUATION AND REQUESTED A MANUAL THAT I CAN USE, NOT THROW AWAY. THEY SAID THEY WOULD GET BACK TO ME. YEAH, WHEN PIGS FLY. TERRIBLE EXPLANATION OF CAMERA FUNCTIONS......

Reviews.Title: Skeptic of Camera Abilities!
Reviews.Author: Sayerone.2012
Reviews.Content: I am not skeptical any more. This camera has turned me into a natural photographer as it is so easy to set up and use. It has more settings than I think I will ever use and it is small enough to not be a nuisance at the Zoo, picnic, and such. You will be amazed at how easy you can become a camera fanatic with this one. For the price - you can't go wrong. Snap and go and shoot movies too - all in one.

Reviews.Title: Sorry, don't like it, my bird flew the coop
Reviews.Author: Marla L Madden
Reviews.Content: I am really sad about this purchase. I bought the wrong camera. I went with the advice of a friend, but now I have a camera that is too technical for me. I shoot wild exotic birds in Florida and was moving up from a point and shoot. The camera came with a tech manual on CD only. Thanks for nothing. I need a book to refer to. By the time I try and set my camera my bird has flown away. So did my money, as I could have purchased a less tech camera with great results for much less.

Reviews.Title: Best camera i have ever owned
Reviews.Author: trenten
Reviews.Content: i love this camera one is it takes stunning great pictures. i love the 30x zoom. also the camera has so many settings i have still not figured out what they all mean. i also love the battery i don't use the camera all the time but the battery stays charged for months at a time and the video is full 1080p also you will be amazed at the sound this camera picks up when in video mode. also it supports super high fps video for super slow motion but the quality of the high speed video is very poor but that has no affect on the rating. all i have to say is buy this i think it matches the quality of a dslr camera but you don't have to spend all the money on different lenses this camera is for the all round photographer or someone who just loves good pictures. but make sure you have some understanding of cameras because the many settings and options will make your head spin but that doesn't bother me. love this thing.

Reviews.Title: Best yet
Reviews.Author: E. Crow "craven raven"
Reviews.Content: I have been using Fujifilm cameras for about 7 years.  The EXR is the best one out yet.  I highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: Great cropping with manual zoom like SLR but with great zoom range 24-750mm
Reviews.Author: Lion Michael "Dreamtoys"
Reviews.Content: Always love the manual zoom.  My 4th Fuji superzoom camera.  But it is not as sharp or a bit grainy at low light.  But the ease or professional zoom like SLR kept me coming back to this series of camera.  Just got the HS50EXR but not time to find out how it is yet.

Reviews.Title: Good Prosumer camera.
Reviews.Author: David Jewell
Reviews.Content: Next best camera to an SLR. The lens could be sharper. I notice when I enlarge on my computer that the details tend to be fuzzy. So birds in flight are difficult. But, still life objects and gardens come out wonderfully.Light weight, not so expensive that I would be hurt if it was dropped or rained on.

Reviews.Title: Good choice!
Reviews.Author: Doris Wolf "dwl"
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with my camera: it is everything I expected! I love taking pictures and this camera has been easy to understand and use.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have owned!  Easy to use and takes excellent photos!
Reviews.Author: A. Rodgers
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Canon Rebel.  I was hesitant to go with a Fuji camera, or a camera with a single lens.  However, I was growing tired of trying to take wildlife shots, and having to attempt to quickly change a lens, and carry multiple lenses through nature trails.  Thus, I was intrigued at the versatility of the single lens.  I absolutely love this camera!  It has proven to take much better photos than the Canon Rebel, as well as every pocket camera I have ever owned.  It is so easy to carry around and simply rotate the lens to get a close or far shot with high quality.  This camera has not let me down!  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Chip
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Takes great pictures and HD video. Daytime pictures are fantastic. Night time sports are tough as it is with all cameras without expensive low light lenses. Would highly recommend. Very easy to use and get fantastic pictures. You can not beat the price on amazon.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Amibel Morales
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent, its image quality is very complete, its large screen to view the image lens and record videos is comprehensive and allows me to watch what I want to capture. Record in full HD quality and I loved it, I can record my videos and capture my favorite moments with this camera. totally happy.

Reviews.Title: So far, I am loving this camera
Reviews.Author: joshuaRobot
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I am no professional photographer. I have only owned one other point and shoot digital camera in my whole life (not including cellphones). When i got this camera, i was looking for practicality. My definition of practicality was that i wanted a camera that could take good pictures in every day situations, hiking, skiing, etc. Basically, i didnt want a DSLR because i didnt want to carry around a lot of lenses.This led me to do extensive research on bridge/superzoom cameras. I understand that at the time of writing this, there is a new generation of these things that i know nothing about. At the time, weighing prices and features, I decided to go with this camera.When i first got it, I went out on a few walks to specifically learn as many features about this camera as i could. Overall, you have a lot of great control with it. I love the manual zoom and autofocus (in some applications). You also have a lot of different modes that are pretty standard to most cameras these days. The one i got the most kick out of was the "pet face detection" mode. This mode will automatically snap a picture when it detects my cat's face.In general, I usually just stick with EXR mode. This is fuji's HDR mode. I have been very impressed with the pictures this camera takes in this mode.Finally, i have to mention the lens. I have gotten some incredible lens flairs with the lens on this camera. My 2 favorite pictures so far are landscapes with the sun and a great lens flair. They really make me look like i know what i am doing.I have seen positive and negative reviews for this camera, but from my experience so far, i have to give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: A Good Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Philip A Cartier
Reviews.Content: Very similar to the previous HS20EXR, but significantly faster overall.Takes good pictures overall, excellent at macro closeups.The default auto modes do a generally good job.The HS30EXR is a very flexible camera, and has lots of settings.  It can take a some experimenting and reading the manual to figure out how to get better results than the totally auto settings.  Like any small sensor camera, the FUJI is not great when the light goes down.  Cloudy days can wash out the picture and dull the colors and focus.  Experimenting with manual changes can greatly improve the pictures in low light conditions.I really like the manual zoom, the excellent viewfinder, the solid build quality and the good continuous shooting capability.(+2)Some easy way to figure out exactly what features are available under which modes would be SOOOhelpful.(-1)The manual is colmplete, but difficult to follow.  Many settings on the camera interact in ways the manual doesn't detail.  Many times it simply says "....may not be available in all modes or settings...."

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin Jeffers
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for Christmas. I have taken a ton of pics with it and taken it on a trip to Alaska. It performs flawlessly. Crisp, detailed images. great colors and wonderful versatility in switching from still photo to HD video. This camera is awesome and I highly recommend getting for anyone!

Reviews.Title: Like it a lot!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Lazar
Reviews.Content: Easy to use even without a lot of digital camera experience. Loads of great options.Makes me a better photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great features for the price
Reviews.Author: Bud
Reviews.Content: Excellent point and shoot capabilities.  I do a lot of macros and it's nice to have it built in and easy to switch to from standard mode.  The zoom feature is good, but gets fuzzy further out in zoom range.

Reviews.Title: my favorite
Reviews.Author: Katlyn
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best cameras i have had, its not heavy so it is very easy to carry around ,fast shooting,great quality in pictures and video , just an amazing camera must buy it

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted
Reviews.Author: Amber L. Duffin "amrunner27"
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I wanted I am a novice that is for sure but the detail that you can get from these pictures is amazing.  I could not be happier with this camera.  It takes some playing around with until you learn what settings to use but it is fun.

Reviews.Title: amazing product
Reviews.Author: harold alexis
Reviews.Content: Great buy would recommend again and again it is so easy to use I love the paranormal camera and the 30 zoom allows you to take pictures as if you where standing in front of whatever your trying to take a picture of.  Go get it

Reviews.Title: One of my favorite cameras :)
Reviews.Author: Abbymariepurdy
Reviews.Content: I got this camera on Dec. 25, 2012. I've gotten to use it for quite some time and I have to say...I LOVE IT. It is such a great bridge camera with amazing abilities. This camera didn't take long to start using. Charge it and go one shooting. I was going to get the Nikon Coolpix p510. I'm so glad I decided to get the Fuji HS30.Reasons why I didn't get the Nikon:-you cannot add filters or additional flash attachments-battery life is said to be poor-cheap body structure-no manual zoom-pricierQuite a list for me. The 42x zoom on the Nikon  was a little too much for me.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The 30x manual zoom and ability to have fisheye, telephoto, lens hood, and filter additions was a big plus for me.  The battery life on the HS30 is beastly. I used it every day, using flash on and off. It lasted two weeks, with 1/3 of the battery left. I was so pleased with that. I'm into photography a lot, and as a 13 year old, I want something that is going to make me want to keep doing what I do. This camera does it. It is one of the best cameras I've worked with. It's my baby:) it's performance is outstanding in any conditions. If you want a step up from a point and shoot, but still don't want a dslr, get this.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera, and I do not have the issues some of the other reviewers reported. In regards to the "focus hunting," I have not had this issue, and even with a DSLR, there are many lenses that "hunt" especially in low light conditions. A number of people have ofered to purchase prints of some of my pictures taken with the HS30.

Reviews.Title: super hs30exr
Reviews.Author: JOHN HOWE
Reviews.Content: its niceconvenient to travel withfull of optionsperfect zoomlooks expensiveeveryting is included in packagingready to shoot pics

Reviews.Title: acceptable upgrade - updated, removed stars
Reviews.Author: Layne Newman "theatercritic"
Reviews.Content: When the auto focus went out on my HS10 i replaced it with this. The only feature that was really better as an upgrade is the panorama shooting capability.07/10/2013 - Updated:The reason I purchased this was because the auto focus went out on my HS10. Now, it turns out, this one is going out also.The guy who tried to repair my HS10 told me this is an anomaly that is not exclusive to Fuji cameras, but I am not happy because this is an expensive item to repair  and Fuji refuses to issue recalls. I have had Fuji cameras for about 12 years now and always upgraded about every 18 months. I think it is time to look at other brands. 2 cameras in 1 year is a bit much.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Monique Anderson
Reviews.Content: I am going to be a new mom and wanted a camera that had features like stabilizer, red eye, portraits, action shots, and filming. It has been years since I have had a decent camera well since actual film. It is light weight has built in flash but also has the feature of attaching an external flash. I love the tilt screen feature for awkward picture taking. The instructions it came with were easy to follow. I have only had my camera for a couple of days and I still need to play around with the manual features. I would definitely recommend this camera. I did a lot of looking around and comparing prices and features. I am extremely happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: vvv
Reviews.Author: Coca Gelu
Reviews.Content: It is good quality work properly and meets my expectations and I would recommend it to other buyers and carriage arrived much earlier and optimal

Reviews.Title: The feel of an SLR all in one compact camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Patton
Reviews.Content: I usually carry a camera with 3 lens and a flash unit. The Fujifilm camera doesn't replace my SLR camera but I been using it more for all my everyday photography.In the automatic mode is very basic. EXR Auto tries to be smart and quick to adjust to different scene selects. It also gives you the options of setting it on how the EXR functions, like low light,dynamic range, high res. In any setting the colors are rich and vivid, which can be changed at any point to your liking. Dynamic range can be changed from 100%, 200% to 400%. Panoramic mode only does 360 view and can't be change which is a bummer. Burst mode disables flash. I generally shoot in manual mode and the light meter does very well when its set to center weight. The camera will start up within a second. There is also a setting that lets it shut down 2-5 minutes but will quick start by pressing the shutter button within 20 minutes.ISO speeds run from 100-1600 without changing photo settings. 3200 ISO runs a 8mp.The lens is about your basic f2.8-5.6. It lacks anything above f11. The focus ring in manual mode is very quick and responsive. Super Macro is sharp and being able to have a bright 3" tilt screen is handy when its not easy to look through the view finder when shooting a macro shot. There is a AE & AF lock on the camera. The fact that it has a focus and telephoto ring, sold me.Shooting Video does pretty good but don't expect the world. You want to make sure the focus is on continuous. Focus is a bit slow and video sometimes has a trail look.The second thing that sold me was the Flash hot shoe. Fujifilm EF-42 is an excellent flash unit. While Fujifilm doesn't provide a sync cord but a Canon sync cord will allow the flash to fully function with the flash.Very good all around camera. It is worth considering if anyone is looking at the "S" series. "HS" series has a little bit bigger sensor then the "S" series. If you like the manual feel of turning a lens instead of pushing a button and/or the need for a hot shoe, this is it. I personally think that this is a great starter camera when learning manual settings. At $300, it a lot of bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Fred Renner
Reviews.Content: I gave this as a gift.  Works great and has lots of features including the option of shooting in RAW format.  This camera is a good alternative to an SLR, easier to use and creates wonderful photos.

Reviews.Title: Got this to replace a stolen Fuji
Reviews.Author: Harrie
Reviews.Content: I think my old model was one step below this, and I loved it.....but it got stolen, so I decided to upgrade a bit.At first I was concerned because it says that it is a hot shoe, and I didn't read anywhere that it had an internal flash (It does).  It's light weight, takes great stills - I love the fact that you have such a great range - 24mm all the way up to 300 on the zoom.  I haven't used it that much since I got it, and in no way have used ALL of  it's many features.  I also like the fact that I can easily switch to video mode if I want to.  It is super light weight, and convenient.  It pretty much gives you the convenience of a smaller camera, with the great pictures of an SLR.I've had manual Nikon's all my life, but my eyesight is going so I really like the auto focus feature of the newer digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted...
Reviews.Author: Leonard "LDR"
Reviews.Content: although a bit heavier than I would have expected, the camera worked perfectly during a recent 6 week trip throughout Europe and the Middle East.  Pictures, in both JPG and RAW, came out amazing.  The zoom factor on this camera has to be seen to be believed - it picked up text in the stained glass of a huge cathedral.

Reviews.Title: Love the Manual Zoom
Reviews.Author: Gregory A Hill
Reviews.Content: A little bit of history to start.  My first camera was a Minolta ST101 with a number of fixed focal length lenses.  Used for many years and then I went to a Cannon EOS.  I was thrilled when lens technology produced a 28-200 mm zoom.  It worked for 90%+ of what I wanted to do but it was big and heavy.Enter the digital camera.  My first was a 2 mpxl Canon Elph.  It took good pictures but not what I was used to.  It fit in my pocket though and convenience was a factor.  I went through several digital cameras as technology developed and my current unit (soon to be back-up) is a Panasonic ZS8.  It takes very good pictures and fits in my pocket.  The EOS was sold on EbayNow, I miss my SLRs viewfinder and all the settings I could adjust to tweak the image.  I do not miss hauling around a bag full of lenses and accessories not to mention exposed film. Enter the bridge camera now come of age.I did hours of research on various camera review sites and on Amazon.  I narrowed my choices to a Fuji HS30 EXR, a Canon SX40HS and a Panasonic FZ60.  On paper I had a difficult time as to which was the best one and ultimately ordered the Canon based open many prior very good experiences with Canon.  I also would have a good idea how to negotiate the camera settings pretty well.It’s a great camera.  I took pictures in the back yard of birds and squirrels, macros of flowers, kids at play and some landscapes with difficult lighting.  I took it on a weekend trip and took some night shots and beach shots and purposely pushed its limits.  I found it a bit slow to focus, especially at the long end and further still with lower light conditions.  I did not like using the motorized long lens and the viewfinder; it was somehow clumsy.I sent it back and got the Fuji HS30 EXR.  First thing I noticed was that focusing is quick and accurate.  I really like how the manual zoom feature works.  It’s a little thing but the size and grip feel better in my hand.The professional reviews made issues of the dots in the viewfinder and the LCD but I did not find those to be issues.  The menu in the Canon is easier to negotiate, maybe because I’ve been there before.  I find the Fuji lens to be plenty long enough but Cannon is clearly longer.  The Canon is better at exposure in difficult lighting but I am used to bracketing under those conditions.  Time will tell but the Canon’s face recognition appears to be better but I will more likely use my Panasonic ZS8 when taking people pictures anyway.When I made the purchase, I was trying to capture the best of a good pocket camera and an SLR and hence my interest in a bridge camera. Either of these cameras would have done the job but I think my heritage with a manual zoom has helped make my final decision the Fuji.

Reviews.Title: You'll like it if you're an amateur looking for really good shots!
Reviews.Author: Muchtaller
Reviews.Content: Lots of features - more than I'll use!  Portrait pictures come out really nice which is 80% of what I take.  The zoom is manual, which gives you better control and speed.  There's an adjustment on the eye viewfinder that helps compensate for those of us who need glasses - very handy and accurate!  I leave it on EXR auto most of the time and my shots turn out great.  I use Google Picasa 3 to edit and I've got great shots.  Short videos are a bit difficult unless you focus at the start and never zoom - hard to do that when your grandson is soooo cute!  For the price and the features - I don't want to be a pro - it gives me what I need for some really nice shots.

Reviews.Title: Fuji HS30EXR zoom stiff and bumpy
Reviews.Author: BeachToothDoc
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the HS30EXR from Amazon and received it quickly as usual.  On opening my camera I charged the batttery and placed a Class 10 SD card in the camera. I took some test shots  in the EXR setting and quality was good.  However, I noticed a problem when zooming.  The zoom is very stiff and at about 105 - 135mm is bumpy or draggy. ( Best way I know how to describe)  Am returning because afraid it may be a gear or other thing that may cause problems in the future.  If any others have noticed this problem, I would appreciate a response as I don't know if this is a common problem or just with the camera I received.Thanks, Ernie

Reviews.Title: It makes my family happy.
Reviews.Author: Cora
Reviews.Content: The dealer sent me the camera very quickly, a very nice and performance camera(it is the second Fujifilm camera that we own). It works great, we are very happy we have bought it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Angel Noguera
Reviews.Content: So far I have had no problems with this camera. This was a good buy. Excellent price value. Very good camera

Reviews.Title: Best value for money
Reviews.Author: glafkos christofidis
Reviews.Content: I have been using superzoom cameras during my travels for a while now and I am astonished at how good this camera is compared to the price.. The HS30EXR is user friendly and ha excellent results indoors and outdoors and astonishing macro performance. A slight limitation towards the high end of the zoom range does not affect my overall assessment and the pleasure of using it.

Reviews.Title: Item works great.
Reviews.Author: John F Hordista
Reviews.Content: Item works like a charm.  Very stable and durable.  I Highly recommended this item.  Perfect size and handle is great.

Reviews.Title: I like this camera, it takes great pictures.
Reviews.Author: Leroy C. Noyes "retired engineer"
Reviews.Content: My major complaint is the software is complicated and the instruction book is not always clear. I would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Happy with purchase
Reviews.Author: Lulu_M
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after returning a Nikon Coolpix ordered from Amazon (with Amazon as the direct seller) that turned out to be a gray-market item. Nikon would not warranty it based on the serial number, and I didn't feel comfortable keeping it. Amazon was good about exchanging the item. (I'm wondering if they resold it to someone else.) They were the direct seller on this camera, too, so I was a little apprehensive that it would also be a gray-market item. When I received it, I immediately registered it on Fujifilm's website, and they recognized the serial number. So, I'm assuming it's legitimate. I've only used the camera a few times now - twice on outings in the great outdoors and once for some inside photos. I've been happy with the results, altho I don't know nearly enough yet about how to use it. I really like the manual zoom, which conserves the battery and (from what I've read) is much less prone to break-down than an auto-zoom, and also the threaded lens, which accepts filters you can buy in any local camera shop. It seems like a nice step up from a simple point-and-shoot but less expensive than a full-fledged DSLR. I would say - after this experience with Amazon, I would only buy an expensive electronic device like this from a reputable online store, such as D&H; Camera, or a local brick-and-mortar store. For me, it's worth paying a little more for the peace of mind. I suppose I'll get a bunch of responses from the Amazon review-watchers that jump on negative comments. Note to them: Other Amazon shoppers have had similar experiences, and I stand by my comments.

Reviews.Title: Super duper camera
Reviews.Author: nadine
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera easy to use very impressed, great for school work for my daughter brilliant photos and great insttructions buy now

Reviews.Title: My "Camera" Camera.
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Kenon
Reviews.Content: I had been on the lookout for a camera for about a year. I had been taking pictures with my iPhone and decided that I really enjoyed the process, but that it was time to move on to a "real" camera. At this point, a DSLR is definitely within my budget but not my level of experience, so I was interested in something that was in between a point-and-shoot and a low-cost DSLR. I found it at Costco, and after perusing the online reviews for a few weeks, I went back to purchase it.I have been extremely pleased with this camera. The image quality is amazing- my only complaint is that there is no way to turn off the "film simulation", which imposes a bit of grain on your photos. Some people may like that, but I would prefer to have it off for most of my pictures. The optical zoom is great, and the EXR setting is very cool. I've been trying to shoot mostly manual as I learn this new photography language (with mixed results as yet), and when I set the aperture and shutter speeds correctly I get great pictures.I'm really glad I found this camera. I'm learning how to take pictures with something other than an iPhone or a compact camera, and in a few years I'll be ready to use a DSLR. Hopefully my wife will be ready to let me spend the money lol...

Reviews.Title: EXCELENTE
Reviews.Author: luiscasanova_32
Reviews.Content: EXCELENTE PRODUCTO MUY ALTA CALIDAD RECOMENDADO PARA TODOS AQUELLOS QUE DESEEN TENER LO MEJOR ENTRE SUS MANOS GRACIAS POR TODO.

Reviews.Title: It's so easy to use and takes EXCELLENT pictures!
Reviews.Author: Eva
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this camera!  It is so consistent and easy to use and takes fantastic pictures!  10 year olds and 90 year olds could easily use it, yet there are enough functions and settings that a 20-something year old could spend days and days messing around with possibly options!

Reviews.Title: Love IT
Reviews.Author: Michelle Eggett
Reviews.Content: it takes great up close pictures. It is a little heavy but other than that i cant find a down fall

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Susan Rapp
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. An excellent quality for the money. Can use it to do any type of photography job and get the same quality as the cameras that cost 10 times as much.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Shaffer
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera and does just what I need.Takes real clear picture and easy to use.I also like the 30 times zoom.I have no dislikes with this camera and would recommend it and had! A good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm HS30EXR Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Eleanor E Olson
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, which is actually a replacement for one I lost! I love the fact that I don't need extra lenses for telescopic photos, or the macro close up shots. It also takes amazing panoramas up to 360*.  It is easy to use and is a "smart" camera  when in auto mode!  I highly recommend it for anyone!

Reviews.Title: Amateur photographer
Reviews.Author: wvukaterx
Reviews.Content: I like the zoom and handling of this camera but it is still probably a little more complicated than I would have liked - have to hold pretty still to get a clear photo. It is also bigger than I thought it would be -  Otherwise, my pictures definitely look better than they would with my old point and shoot. Has a nice "face finding" option and EXR mood to automatically select the right options.

Reviews.Title: A Reasonable Camera with a View Finder
Reviews.Author: elizabeth alter
Reviews.Content: It is taking me some time to get to learn the camera as there are so many permutations that my head spins every time I pick it up. I do love having a view finder; however, having such a big view screen is great as well. So far the color looks great on the photos I have taken and, with adequate light, you can even take photos indoors without using the flash. The only problem I am having so far is the delay between focus and shooting. No regrets so far.

Reviews.Title: go for the money you pay for
Reviews.Author: Jack T. Liu
Reviews.Content: is a good camera if you don't want to spend too much money I take good pictures,  it is well constructed

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: John Arvanitis "a man wired"
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the money.Very long zoom, hot shoe, ability to zoom in and out while taking video.Long lasting battery.I would have given it 5 stars, but you have to take the battery off, to charge it.

Reviews.Title: A very nice, extreme zoom camera.
Reviews.Author: K. Lake
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift.  My wife wanted a digital camera with a viewfinder that you hold up to your eye and a long telephoto lens.  This camera has the highest resolution viewfinder that I could find and it is beautiful.  It also switches automatically between the back LCD display and the viewfinder.  The telephoto is 30x which is terrific.  The camera is image stabilized so the telephoto is useful at full range.I really like the camera and so does my wife.  It is compact, fits her hands well, and is light.I would have given it a 5 but the battery charger came with a European type cord.  I could not plug it in to charge the battery and there were a few tense moments as she unwrapped the gift.  I managed to replace the end on the cord, but this should not be necessary.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: mike richardson
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use and very well laid out, love the manual focus. Great camera for a beginner that is looking to get more out of a camera than a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix HS30EXR Cámara Digital
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: Excelente El Producto y el envio a Tiempo, 100% recomendable, Producto de Calidad y original, La Respuesta a la hora de comprar es inmediata.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Hs30 review,
Reviews.Author: Burnett Toney
Reviews.Content: I love the Camera the hs30  it does more than i expected, the pictures are beautiful, the camera is great to work with, it just takes some playing with to get your best shots and video.

Reviews.Title: My New  Fuji
Reviews.Author: Lynn Kacsmar
Reviews.Content: It was everything i expected, now I just have to learn all the new things it does compared to my old one. This is my 3rd fuji and I really like how they handle. The only real new thing that I am not sure I like is that I have to dial out the lense, so it takes two hands and my old one  just had a leaver you pulled., so you only needed one hand and now it takes two. But I like the new larger zoom lense.

Reviews.Title: It's a perfect camera, I love it
Reviews.Author: Mangumwhitehouse Will Sanders "W.S."
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera, it works pretty good, price performance and quality is fantastici have only one small suggestion, there should be an icon to show the status of SOUND ON or OFIt took some time to find out that with a certain setting of video the sound is not onMy Fujifilm FinePix HS30EXR Digital Camera performs even a let better then i expected, the zoom 60 times works great and I'm very pleased with the super macro potability, i use it a lot for making pictures of the movement of pocket watches and all.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera.
Reviews.Author: Anthony Tagliatela
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera because I wanted a point and shoot camera that took quality pictures like a DSLR without any of the hassle. I also liked the idea of a telephoto lens with a manual ring .I have not used the camera much yet but so far it even better than I expected. In coming days I will get out and do some picture taking and write more. I would recommend this camera to other who wand a good quality camera all the fuse of a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Strongly recommended
Reviews.Author: turan k
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm Finepix HS30EXR is really an awesome product. The quality of the pictures and movies are high quality and very differen from point and shot cameras. But it's price is nearly the same with a point and shot.

Reviews.Title: VERY good camera and reasonably priced. Good value.
Reviews.Author: Richard Mount
Reviews.Content: Excellent photos and easy to use. I like the manual zoom and manuals focus. The camera lens accepts 58 mm filter and zoom multipliers similar to SLR cameras.

Reviews.Title: This Camera is amazing like Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Alex Puez
Reviews.Content: I don't usually submit reviews but this is worth every penny! It took every pictures just like the advertised it. It's a recommendation to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Much better than Fujifilm 1000fd
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this camera after my old one had started to wear, and the batteries kept falling out. I am a geology student, so I used it immediately for taking up-close photos of rock samples. Not only are its images several times bigger and sharper in macro mode, but the camera itself is also designed better.The rechargeable Li-Ion battery is a huge plus, and it's kept in a separate compartment as the SD card. It's also snapped in for double protection so it will never fall out.

Reviews.Title: Perhaps the best super zoom out there
Reviews.Author: Dale K. Morris "Dalesky"
Reviews.Content: Here's why-  it zooms enough, but not too much so that it is impossible to get good shots at high zoom.The viewing screen moves a bit, but not too much, yet there is a fully functional eyepiece, which many still prefer over screens.The flash is adequate, BUT the camera has a hot shoe. Fujifilm makes 3 flashes that fit the camera, starting at under $100.Like many camera of this type, it offers so many creative controls and settings.Two other things I like a lot are the ability to use a lens hood and lens filters. Just like a DSLR, and I don't know if any other super zoom offers this.I know this is not their latest model, which makes it even a better deal, since prices are now discounted.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Camera-
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Have had it less than a week- For less than $300- its worth it.  Actually feel like a photographer now, with the manual zoom you can really work it!!!  Digital zoom is (ok) not much to it, the different films you can select from are cool, the only negative thing so far is...learning all the $h!* this camera CAN do- because the manual is kinda bare.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: sunflem
Reviews.Content: Really good camera; it is a  very good bridge camera between a point and shoot and a dslr!So far, it has been  very easy to use!Nice purchase at about $150-$200 less than an entry dslr!

Reviews.Title: Seller sent unusable product
Reviews.Author: Big Baloo
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  So far it is everything I wanted and expected and then some.  Did have a problem with the seller sending a charger that was incompatible with American outlets.  They were no help so, I fixed it myself.  Once the battery was charged I put the camera thru its paces and it performed admirably.  This is an upgrade from my old S9000.  Using it now would be like using an Instamatic with a flashcube.  I do a lot of nature shots with a fair amount in macro. The macro is just as good if not better than my old S9000, have to use some more to see if any difference.  However the 30x optical leaves my old S9000 in the dust.  The 60x intelligent zoom is mind blowing, got some bird shots worth the price of the camera and the hassle with the charger.  The digital zoom on my S9000 never took one usable picture, way to grainy.  Showed this camera to a few friends, now they are looking to get one too and one of them shoots professionally hejust really like the look and feel not to mention all the funtions, has to get him one.  Just had to advise them who not to buy it from.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Roberto
Reviews.Content: I just got it and i love it already! The zoom is great, the high ISO, the EXR mode and the focus shift

Reviews.Title: A great product.
Reviews.Author: Les Gibson
Reviews.Content: Works great and takes nice pictures.  Just wished the instrution manual would come with it.  Being a novice with a Hi-Tech camera I had to have one printed out.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Ram
Reviews.Content: Good camera for a good price. Easy to use and almost basic DSLR like quality. Great for beginners like me.

Reviews.Title: HS30EXR REVIEW
Reviews.Author: BILLB
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA EXCEEDED ALL MY REQUIREMENTS. QUALITY,FEATURES AND PRICE WERE EXCELLENT. I LOVE THE CONTINOUS SHOOTING FEATURES AND THE LITHIUM BATTERY SEEMS TO LAST FOREVER. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA TO ALL SERIOUS PHOTO AMATURES.

Reviews.Title: Love my Fujifilm FinePix HS30EXR Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Iris Nedza "Iris"
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with my Fujifilm FinePix HS30EXR Digital Camera. The price through Amazon was the best price received from all the places I checked out. The camera is all I hoped for in a camera. Easy to use, takes wonderful pictures, and does sharp clear pictures on the micro-mini pictures that I do of my dollhouse miniatures and nature photography. I recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Amazing images and features for this price.
Reviews.Author: Best USA Goods
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the features of other professionals. You can work with automatic and fully manual. Lightweight, very practical. I am very pleased, has all the features that a professional camera, with the difference in price.

} } } Length:: 1:16 MinsHello Everyone, I am submitting this review for one reason only: To find out if the various noise distortion I am hearing during recording and playback is normal. I know very little about photography, and I got this camera yesterday from another site (used / like new for a good price) and - as much as I like it - I will have to return it if it is defective. I have spoken with several people today, neither of whom could tell me what is normal for this camera. Other than the distortion, I like the camera. Please help me figure this out. As you can tell in the video, I did not have and extraneous sounds going on at the time. Usually I hear lots of motorized sounds, this time, there was more popping than usual.I am a bit under a deadline as I am hoping to use this at a lecture and concert next week, this is why I am desperately trying to find out what is (a)typical here. Even if I am not doing anything, and I just hold the camera to my ears, I can hear a low hissing sound. I have adjusted the playback volume, which has not helped. I do not know if there is a mic sensitivity level to adjust; I have not found one. I am actually hoping that the cause is due to user error - but....Thanks for your feedback, and I certainly will adjust review and rating accordingly.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm HS30EXR
Reviews.Author: Yolanda Musante
Reviews.Content: I bought these cameras for my relatives.... They are happy, with the quality of the cameras. The pictures, the colors and the sharpness are excellent!!!!! Also, I would like to make a comment about the seller.  We thought that we were not going to receive the cameras on time as we needed them. But, delivered was on time as we were promised.... Seller is the best!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Loving It
Reviews.Author: Gretchen
Reviews.Content: We've only had the opportunity to use our new camera a few times so far, but we are loving it!  Downloading pictures to my laptop was a bit combersome at first, but it's getting easier with use.

Reviews.Title: So far can't complain
Reviews.Author: agreco726
Reviews.Content: I'm REALLY new to photography and these kinda cameras. I'm still learning with this camera but I love it and couldn't have asked for a better camera. I can't go into detail like some other folks here because I'm still learning EVERYTHING about the camera and photography but so far its amazing. It takes amazing pictures if you have it on the right settings for your picture. I have nothing bad to say about it.

Reviews.Title: no room for regret
Reviews.Author: BENAMER
Reviews.Content: This is very cool cam loaded with many features, needs weeks to get used on it and remember all the staff inside..... the only negative for me is its video recording not as perfect as the shooting mode for me it isn't a problem at all

Reviews.Title: hs30exr
Reviews.Author: purple_unicorn
Reviews.Content: I received this camera and was pleased with it from the start.  My father had the great-great-grandmother to this camera, and we have ALWAYS been pleased with Fuji cameras.  It works well getting excellent pictures for me.  It has more bells and whistles than I will probably ever use.  I have just scratched the surface with it's features.  LOVE this camera!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Art Edwards
Reviews.Content: I got this for my birthday.  Love the camera.  Haven't figured out everything yet but it took some great video of 2 waterfalls. I had a lower MP Fujifilm camera before, nothing wrong with it either.  Still use it too.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this unless deeply discounted..get the HS50EXR
Reviews.Author: THE-GO-BETWEEN
Reviews.Content: ...first I think the HS50EXR will solve all these problems on the HS30EXR...1.  The camera hunts painfully at full extension to focus...it is nearly useless ...I have never seen a camera fail so miserably at being able to focus....worst ever and bad enough to totally not buy this camera .....The new HS50EXR goes out of its way to redo the focusing technology but it is pretty bad that they got it so darn wrong on the HS30EXR....2.  why have an LCD that only partially articulates? ..The HS50EXR does it right...Camera makers must stop doing this b.s. with LCD's......do it right or don't do it at all...Full articulation is the only way to go..Unfortunately the Sony A37 has the same type of partially articulating LCD as the 30EXR. But at least the Sony has an APS-C sized sensor compared to the tiny one on the 30EXR.3.  The lens hood that comes with the camera is the cheapest hood I have ever seen on a camera....I lost mine in good wind up by Ridgecrest the first time I used it...it is so light that when it blew off the camera  it got blown into the desert shrubs and I never could find it again..it probably ended up in Baker, CA...will try an EBAY replacement. But this lens hood is a Fuji embarrassment.4. Some people complain about not using AA batteries and I say good riddance. You can buy plenty of inexpensive chargers and 3rd party batteries on EBAY or AMAZON.  AA batteries suck.5.  I love the camera build and the fact it has a manual zoom..6.  I bought this camera along with a Sony SLT A37 DSLR because of all the cool features each has to supplement my Nikon D2Xs and D2Hs cameras...I found that I used the Sony A37 the most however...7.  A nice feature is that you can put on lens filters without using some goofball extension gizzmo.8.  The HS30EXR is so full of features that you really have to study the manual before using it.. ...it is sinking with features that are not intuitive in the least. If you don't get to the point of having good and quick operational knowledge of all the features then it is not worth price.  You can go to KEH.COM and buy a used Panasonic LUMIX FZ30 for about 120 dollars and have a great bridge camera for hardly any cost if you don't want to mine the features on these Fuji HS EXR line of cameras. If you have to fumble around trying to execute esoteric camera abilities then what good is a camera with all these features?  So be prepared to study and then practice if you want to push this camera to its limits.don't buy this Fuji HS30EXR camera unless it becomes deeply, deeply discounted....instead buy the HS50EXR if user feedback is good....The terrible focus abilities of this camera should make it off limits to making this purchase in my opinion...I own this camera and am sorry to make this statement but that's the way it is.Fuji's next step is to load this side of their line  with a full size APS sensor and about 5FPS for 25 or 30 frames meaning having a good buffer... Fuji needs to take these last marketing steps and give consumers a true, robust bridge camera.....that is why considering the Sony SLT A37 instead of these bridge cameras might be a good option even if you don't own any Sony or Minolta glass. The first manufacturer who can do this for around 400-500 dollars will have a real gem.  The new mirrorless niche lines coming out like the Nikon V2/J2, Sony NEX, and other similar cameras don't fill this gap since their sensors are not at least APS sized. Consumers are being jobbed over and over by these major camera makers to the point consumers are just telling them to go fly a kite and are using handheld phones/devices to totally replace traditional cameras especially with the introduction of APS for these cameras including auxiliary lenses that can be placed on these devices. The consumer has been jerked around so much re sensor size that many will have lost patience with the whole b.s. marketing scheme and just ignore these producers. Nikon and Canon cannot survive alone on their pro line. Fuji has NO pro line so they are positioned to cut from the pack and really do bridge cameras correctly.Fuji is clearly just about there but will they keep playing games like Canon and Nikon who have an entire pro line to support and sustain?  Fuji doesn't have this to worry about. They could blow apart the market if they decided to do it.  They have the camera body to accommodate this next step...the point being that if Sony can make the SLT A37 full of features and advancements for about the same price as this nearly highest end of Fuji bridge cameras, then there is no excuse not to make these improvements re sensor size and buffer/FPS.  The Fuji HS50EXR could have been that camera...maybe their next iteration of this HS EXR line will take that leap.Because of the miserable failure of the HS30EXR to focus at full to nearly full zoom extension...it is definitely condemned to the leper colony of bridge cameras and point and shoot cameras in general.

Reviews.Title: Photos for a once in a lifetime trip
Reviews.Author: Maya Wariyar
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for a once in a lifetime trip to Kenya.  It was a dream trip and had been in planning for years.  We are not very good photographers, but wanted a camera where we could take pictures to remember everything.  We knew our point and click camera really wouldn't do the job. But learning everything about a DLSR was just too intimidating. The HS30EXR was a good compromise.  It has a 30x zoom that we thought would do the job. The camera turned out to be very good for the trip.  We got great pictures of the Indian Ocean during sunrise and sunset.  The pictures of the animals on safari turned out to be very good.  We bought a 32 GB Transcend memory card that held the 1900 plus pictures we took on the trip.  The conditions for taking pictures were difficult because of early morning and late afternoon lighting plus animals moving through varied terrain.The few negative things to mention are:1. The automatic settings created pictures that were too bright in many shots.2. In the bright sunlight of the Kenyan savanna the image on the screen was not very visible.  The viewfinder was the better choice for taking pictures.3. The flash would not get ready very quickly.  I missed a shot of a rare bush baby because of the flash.4.  After the trip, I went through and had to adjust some of the pictures for brightness.  Again, I'm not very sophisticated so I just used Microsoft Office Picture Manager to adjust the brightness.  Nothing complex, just a mouse click.There were a few accessories that work well with this camera.  I recommend the 32 GB Transcend memory card and the following:1. Starter Accessories Kit For Fuji Fujifilm FinePix HS30EXR.  (Butterfly Photo had an affordable one.)2. Spare battery and charger.The HS30EXR camera captured many great images for us.  It was a trip of a lifetime and we have pictures to remember it by.

Reviews.Title: So far.. love it
Reviews.Author: Vegas Varmins "Pet Person"
Reviews.Content: I haven't spent a lot of time with this yet. I shopped for hours at Christmas trying to find the best "bridge" long-zoom camera. I actually bought a different one first and then was just reading some reviews and happened to spot this. I got a great deal from Amazon, so the other one went back and this came instead! So far I am amazed by the features on this. You can add filters (very rare in compact all-in-one digitals), shoot RAW (better for Photoshop or other higher end software - also rare in compacts). Has an actual eyepiece - which I might not use all the time - but what a nice option - AND it has the ability to focus the eyepiece! Great zoom - with the ability to manually adjust zoom on lens. Then the Macro feature - so close you can practually touch the lens to something and still focus! Tons of features... I will update this later to add photos and more feature reviews.

Reviews.Author: Fabio
Reviews.Content: It has lot of improvements compared with HS20, faster saving photos, more pictures options and 2x digital zoom. I think I did a good change

Reviews.Title: Viewfinder isn't a viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Petra Larsen
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because as an older person with multifocals I find using a screen-only camera difficult in most conditions. This FinePix camera has a mini-screen in a viewfinder not an optical viewfinder. It is impossible to view it with or without my glasses. I'm having to shoot and hope for the best.The lag between photos is too long. I bought this camera because of the 720mm equivalent lens. I like to photograph birds - by the time I've got one shot off and waited for it to reset the bird is usually gone. The screen takes time to reset and refocus after every shot.On the positive side the images are clear. I will definitely sell this camera on.

Reviews.Content: If it was a little more user friendly I would have probably given it a 5 star rating, but still trying to figure out how to use all the features but so far I am loving it.

Reviews.Title: Not a favorable recommendation
Reviews.Author: Jim Forbes
Reviews.Content: I was in Patagonia for 3 weeks and bought the camera for this purpose. My first surprise was that the telephotoWas manual.  I got use to this softer a while.  My biggest complaint is the auto focus. It seemed to take forever tofocus.  Trying to take pictures in the jungle were very frustrating.  The camera didn't seem to know what to focus on so it would take many seconds to get what I wanted.  All the settings are nice but not necessary.  I had a less expensive Fuji camera many years ago which I was quite happy with.  Not sure about this one.  I don't think I would recommend it because of the focus issues and the manual telephoto.

Reviews.Title: Awesome  camera
Reviews.Author: Alex Kohn
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull camera,,, and the manual telephoto was a pleasant unique experience,,,one  I have not experieced before,, And I enjoyed it.  UNFORTUNATELY,, the camera could not keep up the focus as quickly as the  manual zoom,  Time I  was ready to shoot,, it "locked into the picture, then took the picture,,  I  needed a  camera with almost  immediate responsiveness.  perhaps the Nikon P510 or the CANON sx30IS ( or it's upgrade if any) can meet my expectations,,,, all being said  for the AVERAGE photographer the finepixHS30EXR is a excellent camera,,, For me unfortunately  it couldn't meet my demands.  I still give it a 5-star rating.  I have had photography as a hobby since the 60's

Im no expert, but I do like it. The only down side is the size, but hey! Who buys this kind of camera worring about the size should buy a cybershot!

Reviews.Title: very happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take good pictures.  Not great masterpieces, I'm not talented enough for that.  I like the zoom and all the settings that can be manually adjusted.  The learning curve was high for me because my last camera was a disposable film camera.  I've had no quality issues, no battery issues, and no setting issues.  There are thousands of reviews of this camera out there, but I thought I'd throw out there that I am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor focus and manual zoom
Reviews.Author: troehe
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera, but I takes several seconds for the camera to focus on the object and then you have to manually zoom in then it takes several more seconds to focus before you can take the picture. If the object moves you have to start all over. If the camera is left alone for more than 15sec. it turns itself off.

Reviews.Title: AVOID this camera - SLOW, soft performance
Reviews.Author: kurvbal
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera after reading many reviews.  The fact that it supported RAW file format and had a 30x zoom for the price all felt too good to be true.  And as it turns out, it was.  This camera is SLOW: to turn on, to wake up, to focus, to switch modes...the list goes on.  It also goes into sleep mode from which it is nearly impossible to wake it without turning it off then on again.  This wouldn't be so bad except that every time you turn the camera off then on again, you lose whatever custom or programmed settings you had made; reprogramming those settings over and over again because this crappy camera can't seem to wake from sleep is a real drag and caused me to miss any number of great shots, exposed properly.  The resolution and crispness of images with this camera is terrible, even in broad daylight with minimal zoom being used; images are SOFT SOFT SOFT.  And forget about any level of sharpness when using the zoom, even at the spec'd 30x, where the image quality is basically unusable, even at snapshot size.  Lastly, the Fuji RAW file format is rarely supported, if at all, by most of the programs out there so beware that you will have to use Fuji's REALLY sucky utility software to access your RAF files - it's a joke: lame, slow funtionality with an interface that looks like it was designed circa 1993.  Take my advice: for another $100, get the Lumix and you'll be A LOT happier.  And for another $300, get the lower end Nikon or Canon.  With this loser of a camera, Fuji proves in spades that you get what you pay for.  Do NOT waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: It Really Is Worse than an iPhone [sort of]
Reviews.Author: K. Barr
Reviews.Content: If your primary need is a powerful zoom and your photographs are intended for small prints and online viewing, this camera will likely give you satisfactory and sometimes even impressive results for a reasonable price. However, if sharp details, overall picture quality, and enlarged prints are necessary and the large zoom is secondary, this camera is likely a downgrade from what you already own.Before purchasing, I saw the overwhelmingly positive reviews of this camera, and one complaining that the pictures weren't as good as an iPhone 4S. I dismissed the latter and purchased the camera. But, he was right [sort of].This camera is the equivalent of a common point-and-shoot, but with a large zoom lens and a lot of manual controls. The 30x zoom is impressive and lets you get much closer to the subject, and in most cases the larger lens gives better depth-of-field effects than a camera phone or even many point-and-shoots. But, even under the best conditions, pictures are noisy and details are muddy and painterly. An iPhone, of course, has no optical zoom, but for close range shots, it does indeed pick-up more fine details with less noise than the FinePix HS30EXR, particularly in lower light situations. To test: With this camera in one hand and my iPhone in the other, I shot several pictures of my dog under indoor lighting. On the viewfinder or even fit onto a laptop screen, the pictures were fairly equivalent; however, zoomed in 100% the differences were clear. Where the iPhone was able to pick-up the detail of individual hairs, the FinePix simply showed a mottled, unclear texture. Outdoor performance was significantly better, but still noisy and lacking detail.Please check professional reviews. Although this camera has a look similar to a DSLR, it actually uses the same tiny image sensor used in a compact point-and-shoot and accordingly produces the same passable but unremarkable images.I sent mine back, and replaced it with a Sony Nex-5N and telephoto lens. That, of course, is a significant price difference and maybe not a fair comparison, but the difference in picture quality is also phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: Largest camera I own
Reviews.Author: Lois Nackerud "Forever Young"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera where you can change the lenses out, but the cost was out of my budget.  After reading tens of camera review, I selected this one.  I discovered through a blog that you can switch out lenses on this one.  It has a 30x zoom and is fantastic!  My last camera had a 5 zoom.  What a difference!

Reviews.Title: please send me the charge
Reviews.Author: Kevin M Dieu
Reviews.Content: please send me the charge. i bought the batteries already. now i just need the charge. thank you and have a happy new year!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed in Fuji Repair
Reviews.Author: Mary Martinez
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for 2.5 months when suddenly I saw black horizontal lines on the screen. I sent it back to Fuji who told me it is most likely an electrical problem, then several weeks later told me the parts needed would take too long to receive and that they would send me a new camera. That was the beginning of November. The holidays have passed and I'm still without my camera.Now to make matters worse, it has gone done in price by $50.00! Just ordered a Cannon point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Mildly disappointed
Reviews.Author: Brent
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera today because it seemed like a fantastic deal, and I was hoping to move beyond using my iPhone 4S to take pictures of everything.  I tinkered with the camera a little on the drive home (because I wasn't driving) and I had some reservations--the image quality was somewhat sharp, but any time you zoomed at all it looked very grainy.I spent the past half-hour with this camera, and I cannot wait to return it.  My iPhone 4S actually takes sharper, crisper photos of sill objects.  I think that's absolutely obscene considering the cost of this camera.  I know I'm a total outlier here, and maybe there's user error taking place, but I read through the manual, tried adjusting the photo quality settings, and how I use the camera, but no matter what I do, the quality of the image is just sub-par for what I expected.Best of luck to anyone who buys it, and I really do hope it does what you want it to do, but for me, I'm definitely regretting the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Fuji camera that I've bought within the past 8 months.  The first one had problems with the panoramic setting.  The right side of the picture was out of focus.  Sent it back.  Today I received this camera and right out of the box I got an "lens control error" message.  Totally defective.  Didn't even take one picture.  Sending it back.  I'm thinking their quality control department either doesn't exist or is constantly out to lunch.  After these two terrible experiences with Fuji I will never buy their brand again.
